The zinc finger transcription factor <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a major regulator of gene expression in erythroid , megakaryocyte , and mast cell lineages .
<extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to WGATAR consensus motifs in the regulatory regions of virtually all erythroid cell - specific genes .

Analyses with cultured cells and cell-free systems have provided strong evidence that <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is involved in control of globin gene expression during erythroid differentiation .
Targeted mutagenesis of the <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in embryonic stem cells has demonstrated its requirement in normal erythroid development .
Efficient rescue of the defect requires an intact GATA element in the distal promoter , suggesting autoregulatory control of <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription .
